grammarPoints.usage: Complex subjunctive usage in formal French with proper temporal agreement
grammarPoints.example: Je doutais qu'il fût venu
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I doubted that he had come

grammarPoints.usage: Literary and formal written French, expressing wishes or doubts in past
grammarPoints.example: Bien qu'il partît tard, il arriva à l'heure
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Although he left late, he arrived on time

grammarPoints.usage: Highly formal literary expression indicating completed past actions in subjunctive contexts
grammarPoints.example: Je ne croyais pas qu'il eût terminé son travail
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I did not believe that he had completed his work

grammarPoints.usage: Expressing hypothetical past events or counterfactual conditions
grammarPoints.example: Si j'avais su, j'aurais agi différemment
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If I had known, I would have acted differently

grammarPoints.usage: Emphasizing exclusivity or limitation in formal discourse
grammarPoints.example: Ce n'est que par l'étude assidue qu'on réussit
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is only through diligent study that one succeeds

grammarPoints.usage: Sophisticated relative constructions in formal written French
grammarPoints.example: L'organisation, laquelle était bien structurée, a réussi
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The organization, which was well structured, succeeded

grammarPoints.usage: Literary and formal register inversion for emphasis or variation
grammarPoints.example: Peut-être viendra-t-il demain
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Perhaps he will come tomorrow

grammarPoints.usage: Expressing future completed actions that will be done before another future action
grammarPoints.example: Quand tu arriveras, j'aurai fini le travail
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: When you arrive, I will have finished the work

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive use after expressions like 'bien que', 'quoique', 'pourvu que'
grammarPoints.example: Pourvu qu'il fasse beau demain
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Provided that the weather is nice tomorrow

grammarPoints.usage: Converting verbs and adjectives into nouns for abstract expression
grammarPoints.example: Son refus d'accepter cette responsabilité était surprenant
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His refusal to accept this responsibility was surprising

grammarPoints.usage: Literary usage indicating immediate past before another past action
grammarPoints.example: Dès qu'il eut terminé, il partit
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As soon as he had finished, he left

grammarPoints.usage: Advanced participial phrases with prepositional nuance
grammarPoints.example: Étant donné la situation, nous avons reporté la réunion
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Given the situation, we postponed the meeting

grammarPoints.usage: Expressing simultaneous or causal relationship between actions
grammarPoints.example: En travaillant régulièrement, on améliore ses compétences
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: By working regularly, one improves one's skills

grammarPoints.usage: Participial phrase functioning independently of main clause
grammarPoints.example: Ses études terminées, elle a cherché un emploi
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Her studies completed, she looked for a job

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif dans propositions indépendantes
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive for wishes, commands, or hypothetical statements in main clauses
grammarPoints.example: Qu'il vienne demain!
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Let him come tomorrow!

grammarPoints.pattern: structure clivée avec ce que/celui qui
grammarPoints.usage: Emphasizing specific elements through cleft constructions
grammarPoints.example: Ce qu'il a dit, c'est absolument vrai
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: What he said is absolutely true

grammarPoints.usage: Advanced use of pronouns referring to complex antecedents
grammarPoints.example: Le rapport, bien que complet, en, soulevait des questions
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The report, although complete, raised questions about it

grammarPoints.pattern: construction avec verbes de perception et infinitif
grammarPoints.usage: Verbs like voir, entendre, laisser with bare infinitive constructions
grammarPoints.example: Je l'ai vu entrer dans le bâtiment
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I saw him enter the building

grammarPoints.usage: Expressing hypothetical or unverified information in journalistic style
grammarPoints.example: Le ministre aurait démissionné ce matin
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The minister reportedly resigned this morning

grammarPoints.usage: Advanced negation patterns including ne...ni...ni, ne...pas...non plus
grammarPoints.example: Ni l'un ni l'autre ne savait la réponse
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Neither one knew the answer

grammarPoints.usage: Abrupt change from past to present narration for dramatic effect
grammarPoints.example: Il marchait tranquillement quand tout à coup il tombe
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He was walking quietly when suddenly he falls

grammarPoints.usage: Emphasizing elements with omitted connecting phrases
grammarPoints.example: C'est à Paris qu'il faut aller
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's to Paris that one must go

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif après verbes de doute
grammarPoints.usage: Using subjunctive with douter, nier, contester
grammarPoints.example: Je ne doute pas qu'il réussisse
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I do not doubt that he will succeed

grammarPoints.usage: Complex noun phrase structures with multiple modifiers
grammarPoints.example: Le système, très complexe et difficile à mettre en place, a échoué
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The system, very complex and difficult to implement, failed

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du passé récent avec venir de
grammarPoints.usage: Expressing actions completed just before the moment of speaking
grammarPoints.example: Je viens de recevoir une lettre importante
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I have just received an important letter

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions de nécessité
grammarPoints.usage: Using subjunctive with il faut que, il est nécessaire que
grammarPoints.example: Il est impératif qu'on règle ce problème rapidement
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is imperative that we solve this problem quickly

grammarPoints.usage: Expressing contrast or concession with emphasis
grammarPoints.example: Bien qu'il soit tard, on peut quand même y aller
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Although it's late, we can still go

grammarPoints.usage: Describing repeated or habitual actions in past
grammarPoints.example: Autrefois, je visitais ma grand-mère tous les dimanches
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In the past, I used to visit my grandmother every Sunday

grammarPoints.usage: Using two object pronouns together in specific order
grammarPoints.example: Je le lui ai donné
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I gave it to him

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive use with le plus, le meilleur, etc.
grammarPoints.example: C'est le meilleur livre que j'aie jamais lu
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's the best book I have ever read

grammarPoints.usage: Literary use of infinitive for dramatic narration
grammarPoints.example: Et le roi de partir sans dire au revoir
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: And the king to leave without saying goodbye

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du conditionnel dans discours indirect
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional used to report what was said or planned
grammarPoints.example: Il a dit qu'il viendrait demain
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He said that he would come tomorrow

grammarPoints.usage: Expressing equality in comparison
grammarPoints.example: Elle est aussi intelligente que sa sœur
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She is as intelligent as her sister

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif après verbes de sentiment
grammarPoints.usage: Using subjunctive with être content que, regretter que, etc.
grammarPoints.example: Je suis heureux que tu sois venu
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I am happy that you came

grammarPoints.usage: Using faire to indicate causing someone to do something
grammarPoints.example: Je fais réparer ma voiture
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I am having my car repaired

grammarPoints.usage: Using imperfect for softening requests or statements
grammarPoints.example: Je venais vous demander un service
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I came to ask you a favor

grammarPoints.pattern: structure avec pronom y de localisation
grammarPoints.usage: Using y to refer to places or abstract situations
grammarPoints.example: Je vais à Paris. Y es-tu déjà allé?
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'm going to Paris. Have you ever been there?

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions de possibilité
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after il est possible que, il se peut que
grammarPoints.example: Il est possible qu'elle arrive en retard
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is possible that she will arrive late

grammarPoints.usage: Using ne without pas in restrictive contexts
grammarPoints.example: Cela ne dure qu'une heure
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This lasts only an hour

grammarPoints.usage: Using present participle to express future or predictive meaning
grammarPoints.example: Attendant votre réponse, je vous envoie mes salutations
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Awaiting your response, I send you my regards

grammarPoints.usage: Using en to replace part of a quantity or indefinite noun
grammarPoints.example: Des livres? J'en ai beaucoup
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Books? I have many of them

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing completed actions in subjunctive contexts
grammarPoints.example: Je doute qu'il ait compris le message
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I doubt that he has understood the message

grammarPoints.usage: Pronominal verbs expressing self-directed actions
grammarPoints.example: Elle s'est levée tôt ce matin
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She got up early this morning

grammarPoints.usage: Using imperfect to express what might have been
grammarPoints.example: Un peu plus tôt et nous le rattrappions
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: A little earlier and we would have caught him

grammarPoints.usage: Placing adjectives after nouns for stylistic or semantic effect
grammarPoints.example: Une beauté extraordinaire et une grâce naturelle
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: An extraordinary beauty and a natural grace

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif après verbes de volonté
grammarPoints.usage: Using subjunctive with vouloir que, désirer que, souhaiter que
grammarPoints.example: Je veux que tu réussisses
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I want you to succeed

grammarPoints.usage: Fronting objects or complements for emphasis
grammarPoints.example: Ce projet, je ne l'approuve pas
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This project, I do not approve of it

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du futur périphrастique avec aller
grammarPoints.usage: Expressing imminent future actions using aller + infinitive
grammarPoints.example: Je vais partir très bientôt
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I am going to leave very soon

grammarPoints.usage: Relative clauses functioning as independent noun clauses
grammarPoints.example: Qui veut voyager doit avoir du courage
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whoever wants to travel must have courage

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive used in comparisons expressing inequality
grammarPoints.example: Il est moins intelligent qu'on le craigne
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He is less intelligent than people fear

grammarPoints.usage: Using multiple adjectives in complex noun phrases
grammarPoints.example: Une politique économique et sociale cohérente
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: A coherent economic and social policy

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi de l'imparfait avec valeur de présent
grammarPoints.usage: Using imperfect for imaginative or hypothetical scenarios
grammarPoints.example: Et si nous allions à la plage demain?
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: What if we went to the beach tomorrow?

grammarPoints.usage: Complex relative constructions with duquel, auquel, etc.
grammarPoints.example: L'organisation à laquelle nous appartenons a réussi
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The organization to which we belong succeeded

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions de crainte
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after avoir peur que, craindre que, redouter que
grammarPoints.example: Je crains qu'il ne soit malade
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I fear that he might be ill

grammarPoints.usage: Using infinitive phrase as the grammatical subject
grammarPoints.example: Apprendre les langues est difficile
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Learning languages is difficult

grammarPoints.usage: Using conditional to give polite suggestions or advice
grammarPoints.example: À ta place, je chercherais un meilleur emploi
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If I were you, I would look for a better job

grammarPoints.usage: Listing items in increasing or decreasing order of importance
grammarPoints.example: C'est une question d'intérêt personnel, national, et universel
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's a matter of personal, national, and universal interest

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du passé composé avec auxiliaire avoir
grammarPoints.usage: Standard usage of compound past with transitive verbs
grammarPoints.example: J'ai acheté un livre intéressant
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I bought an interesting book

grammarPoints.usage: Placing noun phrases side by side for clarification or expansion
grammarPoints.example: Napoléon, l'empereur des Français, a conquis l'Europe
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Napoleon, the emperor of the French, conquered Europe

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif après expressions de jugement
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive with il est important que, il est dommage que
grammarPoints.example: Il est regrettable que tu n'aies pas pu venir
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is regrettable that you were unable to come

grammarPoints.usage: Placing adverbial or adjunctive elements outside main clause
grammarPoints.example: Franchement, je ne suis pas d'accord avec toi
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Frankly, I disagree with you

grammarPoints.usage: Literary narrative tense for completed actions
grammarPoints.example: Il entra dans la salle et vit ses amis
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He entered the room and saw his friends

grammarPoints.usage: Postposed participial phrases for stylistic effect
grammarPoints.example: La nuit tombée, les étoiles brillaient
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: With night fallen, the stars shone

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions de temps
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after avant que, jusqu'à ce que, etc.
grammarPoints.example: Avant qu'il ne parte, dis-lui la vérité
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Before he leaves, tell him the truth

grammarPoints.usage: Multiple qualifiers creating sophisticated descriptions
grammarPoints.example: Une personne intelligente, cultivée, et profondément humaniste
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: A person who is intelligent, cultured, and deeply humanistic

grammarPoints.usage: Future perfect expressing supposed or hypothetical past actions
grammarPoints.example: À ce moment-là, il aura probablement terminé
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: By that time, he will probably have finished

grammarPoints.usage: Using ceci, cela, celui-ci, celui-là in sophisticated contexts
grammarPoints.example: Cela dépend de celui dont tu parles
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: That depends on the one you are talking about

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions de doute existentiel
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing doubt about existence or reality
grammarPoints.example: Je doute qu'il existe une solution parfaite
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I doubt that a perfect solution exists

grammarPoints.usage: Connecting clauses without conjunctions for effect
grammarPoints.example: Il vint, il vit, il conquit
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He came, he saw, he conquered

grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect expressing repeated actions in past
grammarPoints.example: Chaque jour, il allait au même endroit
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Every day, he went to the same place

grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive introduced by prepositions like à, de, pour
grammarPoints.example: Il s'efforce de réussir dans ses études
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He endeavors to succeed in his studies

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du conditionnel dans hypothèse mixte
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing condition in past and consequence in present
grammarPoints.example: Si j'avais étudié, je serais un expert maintenant
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If I had studied, I would be an expert now

grammarPoints.usage: Complex prepositional phrases in formal registers
grammarPoints.example: En dehors de ces considérations, il faut aussi penser à l'avenir
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Apart from these considerations, one must also think about the future

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec adjectifs indéfinis
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after aucun, certain, quelconque used as adjectives
grammarPoints.example: Je ne connais aucun homme qui soit aussi compétent
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I know of no man who is as competent

grammarPoints.usage: Placing adverbial phrases at the beginning for emphasis
grammarPoints.example: À la fin de la journée, nous étions épuisés
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: At the end of the day, we were exhausted

grammarPoints.usage: Literary usage of past anterior for rapid sequence of events
grammarPoints.example: Dès qu'il eut compris la situation, il agit
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As soon as he had understood the situation, he acted

grammarPoints.usage: Comparing without explicit comparative words
grammarPoints.example: Il travaille comme un fou pour terminer le projet
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He works like a madman to finish the project

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif dans phrase exclamative
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive used in exclamatory constructions expressing wishes
grammarPoints.example: Que Dieu te bénisse!
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: May God bless you!

grammarPoints.pattern: construction avec ne explétif en subordonnée
grammarPoints.usage: Using ne without negating function in certain constructions
grammarPoints.example: Je crains qu'il ne soit trop tard
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I fear it might be too late

grammarPoints.usage: Using present tense to express universal truths
grammarPoints.example: L'homme est un animal social
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Man is a social animal

grammarPoints.pattern: structure avec pronom relatif composé en contexte
grammarPoints.usage: Complex relative constructions with specified antecedents
grammarPoints.example: La cause pour laquelle nous nous battons est juste
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The cause for which we fight is just

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du conditionnel de probabilité atténuée
grammarPoints.usage: Using conditional to express reported information with skepticism
grammarPoints.example: Selon les rumeurs, il aurait remporté le concours
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: According to rumors, he supposedly won the competition

grammarPoints.usage: Participial phrase independent from main sentence structure
grammarPoints.example: Tout bien considéré, nous devons accepter cette offre
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: All things considered, we must accept this offer

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif après expressions de crainte avec ne
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive after fear with expletive ne
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive with crainte and ne appearing together
grammarPoints.example: J'ai peur qu'il ne s'endorme au volant
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I fear he might fall asleep at the wheel

grammarPoints.usage: Stacking multiple clauses for cumulative effect
grammarPoints.example: Alors qu'il marchait, alors qu'il pensait à l'avenir, il souriait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As he walked, as he thought about the future, he smiled

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du passé composé avec semi-auxiliaire
grammarPoints.usage: Compound past with verbs like venir de, aller, pouvoir
grammarPoints.example: Il va falloir prendre une décision
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It will be necessary to make a decision

grammarPoints.usage: Multiple inversion patterns in formal discourse
grammarPoints.example: Non seulement viendra-t-il, mais encore apportera-t-il des cadeaux
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Not only will he come, but he will also bring gifts

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec verbes impersonnels
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after il convient que, il importe que
grammarPoints.example: Il convient qu'on rappelle les règles
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is fitting that we recall the rules

grammarPoints.usage: Building restrictions or limitations progressively
grammarPoints.example: Non seulement ce n'est pas beau, mais ce n'est pas utile
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Not only is it not beautiful, but it is not useful

grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect describing background or setting for past event
grammarPoints.example: Il pleuvait quand j'ai quitté la maison
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It was raining when I left the house

grammarPoints.usage: Multiple uses of que in nested structures
grammarPoints.example: Je pense que tu crois que c'est vrai
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I think that you believe that it is true

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif dans condition négative
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after if not, unless (negative condition)
grammarPoints.example: À moins qu'il n'arrive demain, nous partirons sans lui
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Unless he arrives tomorrow, we will leave without him

grammarPoints.usage: Adding clarifying information at the end for completeness
grammarPoints.example: Il a échoué, chose surprenante étant donné ses efforts
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He failed, which is surprising given his efforts

grammarPoints.usage: Using future to express logical consequence or conclusion
grammarPoints.example: S'il a terminé le projet, ce sera un succès
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If he has finished the project, it will be a success

grammarPoints.pattern: construction avec adverbes modifiant proposition entière
grammarPoints.usage: Sentence adverbs expressing speaker's evaluation
grammarPoints.example: Franchement, cette solution est inacceptable
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Frankly, this solution is unacceptable

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions de possibilité négative
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive with expressions of negative possibility
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing doubt about what cannot be
grammarPoints.example: Il est peu probable qu'il vienne
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is unlikely that he will come

grammarPoints.usage: Parallel construction of grammatically similar elements
grammarPoints.example: Il aime lire, écrire et voyager
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He likes to read, write, and travel

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du conditionnel dans narration hypothétique
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional telling what would happen if conditions were met
grammarPoints.example: Si on enlevait la gravité, nous flotterions dans l'air
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If we removed gravity, we would float in the air

grammarPoints.usage: Moving element to the left for emphasis with resumptive pronoun
grammarPoints.example: Ce problème, on l'a discuté longtemps
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This problem, we discussed it at length

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec prépositions temporelles
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after prepositional phrases expressing time
grammarPoints.example: Après qu'il soit parti, nous avons diné
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: After he left, we had dinner

grammarPoints.usage: Participial phrase functioning as appositive
grammarPoints.example: L'écrivain, inspiré par ses expériences, a écrit un chef-d'œuvre
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The writer, inspired by his experiences, wrote a masterpiece

grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect expressing ongoing action interrupted by another
grammarPoints.example: J'était en train de travailler quand il a appelé
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I was working when he called

grammarPoints.usage: Expressing multiple limitations or conditions together
grammarPoints.example: Ce n'est ni bon ni mauvais, c'est simplement banal
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is neither good nor bad, it is simply ordinary

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec conjonctions concurrentes
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after bien que, quoique, encore que
grammarPoints.example: Bien qu'il soit compétent, il a échoué
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Although he is competent, he failed

grammarPoints.usage: Expressing negation without explicit negative marker
grammarPoints.example: Je refuse d'approuver cette décision
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I refuse to approve this decision

grammarPoints.usage: Perfect expressing causative action completed
grammarPoints.example: J'ai fait construire une nouvelle maison
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I had a new house built

grammarPoints.usage: Building ideas progressively through coordination
grammarPoints.example: D'abord il fallait résoudre ce problème, puis vérifier les résultats
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: First we had to solve this problem, then verify the results

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec verbes de persuasion
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after convaincre que, persuader que
grammarPoints.example: Je l'ai persuadé qu'il fallait accepter
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I persuaded him that he had to accept

grammarPoints.usage: Listing or explaining elements with parenthetical style
grammarPoints.example: Les avantages sont multiples — économie, efficacité, modernité
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The advantages are multiple — economy, efficiency, modernity

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du futur antérieur dans condition
grammarPoints.usage: Future perfect expressing prior completion in future time
grammarPoints.example: Quand tu arriveras, j'aurai tout préparé
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: When you arrive, I will have prepared everything

grammarPoints.usage: Nested relative clauses creating complex sentences
grammarPoints.example: Le livre que l'auteur que tu as rencontré a écrit est excellent
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The book that the author you met wrote is excellent

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif dans questions rhétoriques
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive used in rhetorical questions expressing impossibility
grammarPoints.example: Que fasse-t-on dans cette situation impossible?
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: What can one do in this impossible situation?

grammarPoints.usage: Passive constructions with elaborate agent expressions
grammarPoints.example: Ce projet a été réalisé par une équipe de professionnels chevronnés
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This project was carried out by a team of seasoned professionals

grammarPoints.usage: Conditional limited by specific conditions
grammarPoints.example: Je viendrais si j'avais le temps
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I would come if I had the time

grammarPoints.usage: Stressed pronouns emphasizing subjects or objects
grammarPoints.example: Moi, je suis d'accord; toi, tu refuseras
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Me, I agree; you, you will refuse

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions d'hypothèse
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after supposer que, imaginer que
grammarPoints.example: Supposons qu'il n'existe pas de solution simple
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Suppose that no simple solution exists

grammarPoints.usage: Listing with quantities or frequencies
grammarPoints.example: Des centaines de gens, voire des milliers, ont participé
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Hundreds of people, even thousands, participated

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du passé simple avec imparfait
grammarPoints.usage: Using both tenses for narrative structure and background
grammarPoints.example: Il entra dans la pièce. Les gens discutaient tranquillement
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He entered the room. People were discussing quietly

grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive with auxiliary-like verbs expressing aspect
grammarPoints.example: Je commence à comprendre la situation
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I am beginning to understand the situation

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions de réalité douteuse
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive with expressions of doubtful reality
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing uncertainty about reality
grammarPoints.example: Je doute qu'une telle perfection soit possible
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I doubt that such perfection is possible

grammarPoints.usage: Adding a clause at the end as an afterthought
grammarPoints.example: C'est une bonne idée, je pense
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's a good idea, I think

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du conditionnel passé de reproche
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing criticism about past actions
grammarPoints.example: Tu aurais pu m'aider, tu aurais dû comprendre
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: You could have helped me, you should have understood

grammarPoints.usage: Using nouns in abstract senses for philosophical expression
grammarPoints.example: La beauté, la vérité, et la justice sont nos valeurs
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Beauty, truth, and justice are our values

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after même si, même supposé que
grammarPoints.example: Même si cela semblait impossible, il l'a fait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even though it seemed impossible, he did it

grammarPoints.usage: Expressing alternatives with nuanced relationships
grammarPoints.example: Ou bien tu acceptes, ou bien tu refuses, mais décide maintenant
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Either you accept, or you refuse, but decide now

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi de l'imparfait avec valeur d'euphémisme
grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect softening or toning down statements
grammarPoints.example: J'aurais une petite question à te poser
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I had a small question to ask you

grammarPoints.usage: Gerund expressing cause for main action
grammarPoints.example: En travaillant dur, tu réussiras à tes examens
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: By working hard, you will succeed in your exams

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec verbes de conclusion
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after conclure que, en conclure que
grammarPoints.example: On en conclut qu'il soit responsable de l'incident
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: One concludes that he is responsible for the incident

grammarPoints.pattern: structure avec complément de manière fronté
grammarPoints.usage: Placing manner adverbial at beginning for emphasis
grammarPoints.example: Avec beaucoup de patience, on peut résoudre ce problème
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: With much patience, one can solve this problem

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du passé antérieur dans style littéraire
grammarPoints.usage: Literary usage marking immediate past before another past event
grammarPoints.example: À peine eut-il fini qu'il regretta ses paroles
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He had scarcely finished when he regretted his words

grammarPoints.usage: Relative clause without antecedent added as appositive
grammarPoints.example: Il a réussi, ce qui l'a rendu célèbre
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He succeeded, which made him famous

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif après expressions de nécessité absolue
grammarPoints.meaning: subjunctive after expressions of absolute necessity
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive with il est impératif que, il est vital que
grammarPoints.example: Il est essentiel que vous compreniez bien
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is essential that you understand well

grammarPoints.pattern: structure avec inversion du verbe auxiliaire
grammarPoints.usage: Inverting auxiliary with subject in formal contexts
grammarPoints.example: Aurait-il vraiment l'intention de partir?
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Would he really have the intention to leave?

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du conditionnel dans narration de conte
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing events in hypothetical narratives
grammarPoints.example: Il y aurait autrefois un prince qui vivrait dans un château
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: There would once be a prince who would live in a castle

grammarPoints.pattern: construction avec participe passé accord complexe
grammarPoints.usage: Agreement rules for past participles in various constructions
grammarPoints.example: Les œuvres qu'elle a écrites sont restées inédites
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The works she wrote remained unpublished

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions de priorité
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after avant que, plutôt que
grammarPoints.example: Je préfère que tu restes plutôt que tu ne partes
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I prefer that you stay rather than leave

grammarPoints.usage: Grouping related items by theme in lists
grammarPoints.example: Les problèmes sociaux, économiques, et politiques se multiplient
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Social, economic, and political problems are multiplying

grammarPoints.usage: Future expressing conditions or uncertainty
grammarPoints.example: Si tu le fais, tu auras des regrets
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If you do it, you will have regrets

grammarPoints.usage: Moving element to the right with resumptive pronoun
grammarPoints.example: Je l'ai vu hier, ton ami
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I saw him yesterday, your friend

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions de regret
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after regretter que, c'est dommage que
grammarPoints.example: C'est dommage que tu n'aies pas pu rester
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's a pity that you could not stay

grammarPoints.usage: Appositive noun phrases with adjectival character
grammarPoints.example: Le professeur, homme sage et expérimenté, nous a guidés
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The professor, a wise and experienced man, guided us

grammarPoints.usage: Using present tense in narratives for vivid effect
grammarPoints.example: Il arrive à la gare, descend du train, et cherche ses amis
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He arrives at the station, gets off the train, and looks for his friends

grammarPoints.pattern: construction avec infinitif en fonction adverbiale
grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive expressing purpose, cause, or condition
grammarPoints.example: Pour réussir, il faut travailler régulièrement
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: To succeed, one must work regularly

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi de l'imparfait de style indirect libre
grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect in narrative reporting of thoughts or speech
grammarPoints.example: Elle pensait qu'elle était libre enfin
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She thought she was finally free

grammarPoints.usage: Causative constructions with multiple levels
grammarPoints.example: Je lui ai fait faire le travail
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I made him do the work

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions d'évidence niée
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after negating certainty or evidence
grammarPoints.example: Ce n'est pas évident qu'il soit venu
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is not evident that he came

grammarPoints.pattern: structure avec adjectif postposé et préposé
grammarPoints.meaning: adjective in both postposed and preposed position
grammarPoints.usage: Different meanings depending on adjective position
grammarPoints.example: Un homme brave et un brave homme
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: A courageous man and a good man

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du passé récent avec valeur de démenti
grammarPoints.usage: Using venir de to contradict previous statement
grammarPoints.example: Mais je viens de vous le dire!
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: But I just told you!

grammarPoints.pattern: construction avec pronoms personnels sujets disjoints
grammarPoints.usage: Stressed pronouns for emphasis or contrast
grammarPoints.example: Moi, je ne suis pas d'accord; lui, il l'accepte
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I do not agree; he accepts it

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif après expressions de priorité
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive with avant tout, d'abord que
grammarPoints.example: Avant tout qu'on respecte la loi
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: First and foremost that the law be respected

grammarPoints.usage: Coordinating ideas without explicit conjunctions
grammarPoints.example: Vous travaillez, vous progressez
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: You work, you progress

grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect describing hypothetical or imagined situation
grammarPoints.example: Demain, je partais pour l'Afrique
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Tomorrow, I was leaving for Africa

grammarPoints.usage: Adjective separated from noun appearing elsewhere
grammarPoints.example: Calme, l'eau reflétait le ciel
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Calm, the water reflected the sky

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du conditionnel dans énoncé d'hypothèse irréelle
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing impossible or implausible conditions
grammarPoints.example: Si les portes parlaient, elles raconteraient des histoires
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If doors could speak, they would tell stories

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif dans structures de répétition emphase
grammarPoints.usage: Repeating with subjunctive for emphasis
grammarPoints.example: Qu'il vienne ou ne vienne pas, peu importe
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether he comes or does not come, it matters little

grammarPoints.pattern: construction avec complément de cause fronté
grammarPoints.usage: Placing causal phrase at beginning
grammarPoints.example: Par manque de temps, nous avons échoué
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Due to lack of time, we failed

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du passé composé avec adverbe temporel
grammarPoints.usage: Compound past with temporal markers
grammarPoints.example: Il a récemment terminé son projet
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He recently completed his project

grammarPoints.pattern: structure avec pronom démonstratif neutre complexe
grammarPoints.usage: Using ce in sophisticated constructions
grammarPoints.example: Ce dont je parle t'intéresse
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: What I am speaking about interests you

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec verbes de conviction
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after croire que, penser que (negated)
grammarPoints.example: Je ne crois pas qu'il ait raison
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I do not think that he is right

grammarPoints.pattern: construction avec infinitif sujet et attribut
grammarPoints.usage: Infinitive subject with predicative expression
grammarPoints.example: Vivre, c'est apprendre
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: To live is to learn

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du présent avec valeur durative prolongée
grammarPoints.meaning: present tense with extended durative value
grammarPoints.usage: Present expressing actions over extended time
grammarPoints.example: Je travaille à ce projet depuis trois ans
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I have been working on this project for three years

grammarPoints.usage: Listing items in order of importance or intensity
grammarPoints.example: D'abord le silence, puis le doute, enfin la révolte
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: First silence, then doubt, finally rebellion

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif après expressions de concession progressive
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive with même si, quand bien même
grammarPoints.example: Quand bien même tu le nierais, c'est la vérité
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even if you were to deny it, it is the truth

grammarPoints.usage: Adjective appearing as appositive
grammarPoints.example: La raison, noble et pure, guidait ses actes
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Reason, noble and pure, guided his acts

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du passé simple dans contexte scientifique
grammarPoints.usage: Preterite in technical or scientific narration
grammarPoints.example: L'expérience démontra l'hypothèse
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The experiment demonstrated the hypothesis

grammarPoints.usage: Passive voice with clear agent specification
grammarPoints.example: Le rapport a été rédigé par nos experts
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The report was written by our experts

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du conditionnel dans contexte d'ironie subtile
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing light irony
grammarPoints.example: Cela serait merveilleux si cela existait
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: That would be wonderful if it existed

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive expressing personal judgment
grammarPoints.example: Je juge qu'il soit digne de confiance
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I judge that he is worthy of trust

grammarPoints.pattern: construction avec participe présent et passé
grammarPoints.usage: Using both types of participles in coordination
grammarPoints.example: Ayant échoué précédemment et essayant maintenant, il persévère
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Having failed before and trying now, he perseveres

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du futur dans narration hypothétique
grammarPoints.usage: Future tense in 'what if' scenarios
grammarPoints.example: Si tu arrives, tu comprendras tout
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If you arrive, you will understand everything

grammarPoints.usage: Placing possessive in non-standard position
grammarPoints.example: Un ami mien vous attendra
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: A friend of mine will wait for you

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du subjonctif avec expressions de perspective
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive in statements of point of view
grammarPoints.example: À mon avis, qu'il soit capable est certain
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In my opinion, that he is capable is certain

grammarPoints.pattern: construction avec gérondif et complément temporel
grammarPoints.usage: Gerund specifying temporal relationships
grammarPoints.example: En attendant votre arrivée, nous préparerons le dîner
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: While waiting for your arrival, we will prepare dinner

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi de l'imparfait dans comparaison implicite
grammarPoints.usage: Imperfect suggesting comparison without explicit markers
grammarPoints.example: Hier, il pleurait. Aujourd'hui, il chante
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Yesterday, he was crying. Today, he sings

grammarPoints.pattern: structure avec restriction avec tant que
grammarPoints.usage: Expressing conditional limitation
grammarPoints.example: Tant que tu restes, je suis heureux
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As long as you stay, I am happy

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du passé antérieur dans énoncé rapporté
grammarPoints.usage: Past anterior in indirect speech
grammarPoints.example: Il dit qu'à peine eut-il compris qu'il refusa
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He said that as soon as he understood, he refused

grammarPoints.pattern: subjonctif après expressions de souhaits intensifiés
grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive with reinforced wishes
grammarPoints.example: Je souhaite vivement qu'on fasse la paix
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I earnestly wish that peace be made

grammarPoints.usage: Listing as appositive clarification
grammarPoints.example: Les trois principes fondamentaux—liberté, égalité, fraternité
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The three fundamental principles—liberty, equality, brotherhood

grammarPoints.pattern: emploi du conditionnel dans assertion prudente
grammarPoints.usage: Conditional expressing reserved or tentative statements
grammarPoints.example: Je dirais que c'est probablement vrai
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I would say that it is probably true

grammarPoints.pattern: structure avec complément de limitation fronté
grammarPoints.usage: Placing limitation phrase at beginning
grammarPoints.example: En matière de politique, je refuse de juger
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As far as politics is concerned, I refuse to judge
